title: Inverse Trig Functions - relating sine to arcsine

content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals sin x"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. It is claimed that if <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals b over a"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="a not equal to 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="open vertical bar b over a close vertical bar less or equal than 1"><semantics><mrow><mfenced close="|" open="|"><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></mfenced><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, then it is always true that <math alttext="x equals arcsin open parentheses b over a close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>arcsin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following conclusions and its rationale are correct?

choices.label: ​The claim is true because sine and arcsine are inverse functions.

​The claim is true because both <math alttext="sin x equals b over a"><semantics><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="x equals arcsin open parentheses b over a close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>arcsin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> have infinitely many solutions that are identical.

​The claim is false because if <math alttext="a less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="b less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, then <math alttext="b over a greater than 0"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​The claim is false because <math alttext="sin x equals b over a"><semantics><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> has infinitely many solutions, but <math alttext="x equals arcsin open parentheses b over a close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>arcsin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> has only one solution.
